title: Master
body: @stefan-jansen - please reject this pull request; accidentally created.

title: windows environment file
body:
Hi Stefan.
this is the environment.yml file I was able to use on my windows machine and it worked. All I did was I deleted all the packages that were not able to resolve and then it worked without a hitch. check it out and if you think it would help the readers who use windows and are having troubles, you could include it in your repo.

title: edgar - fix download code
body:
* fix variable names
* download all (remove `[-4: -3]`)
* also doesn't seem to require special url for any quarter in 2020

Also, take a look at: https://github.com/shlomikushchi/zipline-trader :)

title: Update NASDAQ ITCH FTP Address
body: The file `10302019.NASDAQ_ITCH50.gz` has been moved to a new folder on the FTP server.

title: fix: AttributeError from feature_name[duplicate]
body: The attribute of 'model' CatBoostRegressor  should simply be 'feature_names_' rather than using as a method. Please refer to [catboost](https://catboost.ai/docs/concepts/python-reference_catboostregressor.html) API and accept this PR.

title: fix: AttributeError from feature_name
body: The attribute of 'model' CatBoostRegressor  should simply be 'feature_names_' rather than using as a method. Please refer to [catboost](https://catboost.ai/docs/concepts/python-reference_catboostregressor.html) API and accept this PR.

title: Seek help to address zipline installation problem
body:
Hi,

I am a reader of the book "Machine learning for algorithmic trading". I encountered a problem when installing/using the zipline library (as described in details in the pull request). I will be very grateful if I can get some help. 

Actually, I am not sure how to reach out for such problems--not sure if it's appropriate to create a pull request either, and my apology if that is the case! I have also sent an email to feedback@packtpub.com and questions@packtpub.com asking the same question.

Thanks a lot!
JC

- Added dockerfile
- Added pyproject.toml, since poetry has better dependency resolution than pip or conda
- Added dockerfile for x86 as well as m1 mac
- Tested on notebooks till ch7, no issues
